resources.string: Interested in music, greatly influenced by Frankie Lymon and the Teenagers, the Platters, Fats Domino, Elvis Presley and Little Richard.

× went to Burnt Ash Junior School and Bromley Technical High School\n× started playing multiple instruments like ukulele, tea-chest bass and piano\n× studied art, music and design, including layout and typesetting

× formed the first band at the age of 15, named the Konrads\n× first breakthrough in 1969 - released the single ‘Space Oddity’\n× best known album - ‘The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars’

× Ivor Novello Special Award For Originality for the single 'Space Oddity'
× two Grammy Awards and three Brit Awards
× inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame on 17 January 1996

string-array.name: quoteArray
string-array.item: I don\'t know where I\'m going from here, but I promise it won\'t be boring.
The truth is of course that there is no journey. We are arriving and departing all at the same time.
I\'m an instant star. Just add water and stir.
I\'m not a prophet or a stone aged man, just a mortal with potential of a superman. I\'m living on.
I believe that I often bring out the best in somebody\'s talents.
I don\'t see any boundaries between any of the art forms. I think they all inter-relate completely.
I change my mind a lot. I usually don\'t agree with what I say very much. I\'m an awful liar.
On the other hand, what I like my music to do to me is awaken the ghosts inside of me. Not the demons, you understand, but the ghosts.
For me, the world that I inhabit in reality is probably a very different world than the one people expect that I would be in.
Even though I was very shy, I found I could get onstage if I had a new identity.
